boat.name: Kate
boat.full_description:
Professionally built by the Liverpool Boat Co. in 1979, Kate is the two berth, cabin version of the Memory.

She was cruised around Hayling Island by David Northcott in the 1980s, then moved to the English north-east coast by Haydn Windle who explored much of the Baltic Coast and Gota Canal from Stockholm in the 1990s. Since 2000, she has been sailed around the Essex Blackwater from Lawling Creek by Keith Davidson.

Her decks were extensively strengthened early in the 1980s with extra knees and beams glassed in, making her very sturdy. There is evidence that she may have had an inboard engine at one time. Keith decided to install an outboard well, designed by Greg Dalrymple at Salterns, and fitted it into the stern deck in 2002.

She has most controls leading back to the cockpit for single-handed use and has a choice of small Cornish or jackyard topsails.
boat.short_description: Kate is a Memory 19, a shoal draft, gaff rigged cutter, designed by Tony Robinson RINA. She is based on the design of Brightlingsea working craft around the 1920s.
